alert.note: Alert for Marion; Mercer; Washington (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 3:39PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Mercer, east central Marion, southeastern Washington and northwestern Boyle Counties through 415 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Springfield, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Boyle, southwestern Mercer, east central Marion and southeastern Washington Counties, including the following locations... Brumfield, Mackville, Gravel Switch, Texas, Pottsville, Dixville, Stewart, Jenkinsville, Nevada and Aliceton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central Kentucky.
